data.title: South Korea’s President Suffers Big Loss in Parliament Vote
data.meta_description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol suffered a major defeat in parliamentary elections that will leave him in a weakened position for the remaining three years of his term and facing greater opposition to his agenda that includes investor-friendly policies.
data.text:
Yoon’s party loses parliamentary seats, opposition gains slots

President to be in a weaker position for last 3 years of term

Get the Year of Elections newsletter – It’s the most fragmented geo-economic landscape in decades. These are the votes that matter to markets, business and policy.

South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol suffered a major defeat in parliamentary elections that will leave him in a weakened position for the remaining three years of his term and facing greater opposition to his agenda that includes investor-friendly policies.
